document_data.caption: The Citadel of Strategic Militancy, just northeast of [[Baldur's Gate]].
document_data.name: Citadel of Strategic Militancy
document_data.event1: Foundation as the Bloodhawk Clan's hold
document_data.ruler3: [[Kaitlin Tindall Bloodhawk]] approximately [[1358 DR|1358]] to [[1370 DR]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''Citadel of Strategic Militancy''' was a fortress dedicated to the [[Red Knight]].{{Cite interactive atlas}}{{Cite dragon/317/Faiths of Faerun: Holy Strategists of the Red Knight|80}}
document_data.Activities: Rarely, the leader of the citadel was known to call all of their officers back in order to lead them into combat. Though many members of the Church of the Red Knight were stationed here, several of its members travelled elsewhere to teach military strategy.
document_data.Geography: The citadel was situated about {{SI|40|mile|k|long=yes}} away from the nearest major settlement, [[Baldur's Gate]] of the [[Western Heartlands]]. Specifically it was located at the intersection between [[Thundar's Ride]] and the [[Coast Way]].
document_data.History:
Prior to its foundation, the founder-to-be [[Taric Bloodhawk]] of the [[Bloodhawk (clan)|Bloodhawk clan]], was involved in battles in [[1241 DR]]. During his battles, he and his clan ransacked an [[orc]] chieftain's stronghold an acquired a grand horde. With the wealth he had acquired, he constructed the castle about 100 years before [[1370 DR]]. The fort became the hold of his clan.

During the [[Time of Troubles]], the last heir of Lord [[Ronlar Bloodhawk]], Lady [[Kaitlin Tindall Bloodhawk]], left the stronghold to explore [[Tempus's Tears]] to the northeast of the stronghold. During the night, she became the avatar host of the Red Knight herself. Together with her band, the [[Order of the Red Falcon|Company of the Red Falcon]], she ventured south and put down a group of monsters that charged out of the [[Forest of Tethir]]. Due to this grand battle, they earned the graititude of the [[Tethyrian]]s. After her grand success, she returned home to the citadel. Unfortunately, her success would come at an enormous cost: the citadel had been razed and all of her clan and their workers, had been slain. She rebuilt the fort to memorialise those who had fallen, and declared it a holy temple to the Red Knight.

In 1370 DR, the fort was well structured and protected, and became the home of the [[Red War College]]. Many lords across [[Faerûn]] sent their officers to the Citadel of Strategic Militancy to become skilled military commanders. During this era, High Lady Bloodhawk commanded the fort as the First Lady Knight of the Red Standard, and many of her knights of the Order of the Red Falcon became instructors in the Red War College.
